results.title: The Big fellow
results.creator_credit: Michel Pearce, Kip Porteous and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: Reconstructs the political career of J.T. Lang, Premier of New South Wales in 1925-1927 and 1930-1932, using contemporary film and stills and the recollections of some of the people most involved. Narrated by Allan Fraser. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Big bang
results.creator_credit: David P. Stone and Coastal Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 17 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
Once Hubble’s Law was accepted; that is the Law of an Expanding Universe, two theories about the creation of the universe were put forward. The Big Bang Theory stated that an initial tiny volume of matter exploded outwards, thus creating the beginnings of the universe. The Steady State Theory put forward by Sir Fred Hoyle, proposed that the universe never had a beginning but that matter was created as the universe expanded. The latter theory was abandoned by scientists, however the quest to determine the age and origin of the cosmos is still of vital importance for astronomers.

results.title: The Bif if
results.creator_credit: Vivienne King and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Looks at research being done on the drug Interferon. It is a substance that has been shown to have an effect on some viruses and tumors and scientists are hopeful that it will cure cancer and other life threatening diseases. A cheap synthetic version, if developed, would enable scientists to meet current world demand.

results.title: The Best thing about conflict (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, ABC-TV (Australia), Monash University and Open Learning Agency of Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
Conflict is a necessary and everyday reality in many organisations and has the potential for both positive and negative outcomes. Managers should aim to both use and resolve conflict and develop effective negoatiation skills. In this episode we find out that conflict is usually unwelcome but sometimes constructive depending on how it is managed.

results.title: The Best of Gillies (Captioned)
results.brief_description: The Gillies Team takes on numerous national treasures (including Bob Hawke, Andrew Peacock, Wran the Man and Don Chipp) and even the odd megabuck personality such as Rupert Murdoch in this new compilation video selected from the hilarious Gillies Report series. Highlights include Bob Hawke as the Invisible Man: the Maralinga Commission (or Wise After the Event) re-enacted in the form of a cabaret, with Mr. Justice McLelland chairing the proceedings in sparkling silver lurex; and John Clarke - posing as a sports announcer - introduces us to the magnificent game of Farnarkeling. Featuring: Max Gillies, John Clarke, Patricia Cooke, Tracey Harvey, Don Watson, Geoff Kelso, Wendy Harmer & Phillip Scott. Rated: PG

results.title: The Beavers break through
results.creator_credit: Boy Scouts Association (Great Britain) and Bristol-Cine Society
results.brief_description: Shows the activities of a patrol of British boy scouts, setting up camp, preparing meals, constructing an aerial ropeway across a creek. A girl hiker who has sprained her ankle provides an opportunity for the scouts to work together in a rescue exercise.

results.title: The Beatles Anthology 8. July 1968 to the End
results.creator_credit: Geoff Wonfor, Chipps Chipperfield, Apple, EMI/Parlophone and Picture Music International
results.brief_description: Things are passing strange and fairly fast but the music holds out until the end. This final tape evades nothing and reveals the rents and splits that ended the 1960s. Episode 8: Ringo quits (slow Helter Skelter in background), making of the White Album, closing the Apple Boutique, intro sequence to Hey Jude, origins of Hey Jude, Get Back sessions, Paul and George argue on film, Magic Alex, Recording at Savile, discussions about the rooftop concert, Paul marries Linda Eastman, drug raids, John marries Yoko, breaking up, Allan Klein, Abbey Road film from last photo session, talking about Free As A Bird, studio out-takes. Other songs include Revolution promo film, Hey Jude promo film, The Long and Winding Road, Let It Be out-take, Don’t Let Me Down, Get Back, Let It Be, Something promo film, Free As A Bird.

results.title: The Beatles Anthology 7. June 1967 to July 1968
results.creator_credit: Geoff Wonfor, Chipps Chipperfield, Apple, EMI/Parlophone and Picture Music International
results.brief_description: It is the Summer of Love, and those whom Timothy Leary has called the “avatars” sing All You Need is Love on black and white television on the first world satellite television program. Episode 5 starts with the leadup to All You Need Is Love, George visits Haight-Ashbury, meditation and the maharishi, Brian Epstein dies, Brian Epstein montage to You’ve Got Hide Your Love Away out-take, making of Magical Mystery Tour [308785], opening the Apple Boutique, the trip to India, the Beatles with ukulele, James Taylor, The Iveys (Badfinger), Mary Hopkins, film from the White Album sessions, Yellow Submarine, the movie and Beatles cameo, Yoko Ono. Other songs include All You Need Is Love broadcast, colourised, Fool On The Hill, Your Mother Should Know, I Am The Walrus, Ed Sullivan intro to Hello Goodbye promo film, Across The Universe out-take montage, Lady Madonna promo film, All Together Now, While My Guitar Gently Weeps demo.
